1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
3{-# LANGUAGE PatternSynonyms #-}
4{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
5
6-- | Mix text.
7
8module Koshucode.Baala.Base.MixText.MixText
9  ( -- * Type
10    MixText,
11
12    -- * Constructor
13    -- ** Text
14    mixBs, mixBz,
15    mixTx, mixTz,
16    mixString, mixChar,
17    -- ** Padding
18    mixLeft, mixRight,
19    -- ** Space
20    mixSpace, mixSep, mixSep2,
21    mix0, mix1, mix2, mix3, mix4,
22    -- ** Number
23    mixOct, mixDec, mixHex, mixSign,
24    mixDecZero, mixNumZero,
25    -- ** Newline
26    mixLine, mixLines,
27    mixSoft, mixHard,
28    mixBreak,
29    -- ** Block
30    mixBlock, mixBlockMap,
31    -- ** Other
32    mixShow, mixEmpty,
33
34    -- * Convert
35    -- ** ByteString
36    mixToBuilder,
37    mixToBz,
38    mixToString,
39    mixToFlatString,
40
41    -- ** Mix I/O
42    putMix, putMixLn,
43    hPutMix, hPutMixLn,
44    putMixLines, hPutMixLines,
45    writeMix,
46  ) where
47
48import Data.Monoid ((<>))
49import qualified Control.Exception                            as E
50import qualified Numeric                                      as N
51import qualified Data.ByteString                              as Bs
52import qualified Data.ByteString.Builder                      as B
53import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy                         as Bz
54import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy.UTF8                    as Bu
55import qualified Data.Default                                 as Def
56import qualified Data.List                                    as L
57import qualified Data.Text                                    as Tx
58import qualified Data.Text.Encoding                           as Tx
59import qualified Data.Text.Lazy                               as Tz
60import qualified Data.Text.Lazy.Encoding                      as Tz
61import qualified System.IO                                    as IO
62import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                     as O
63import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.MixText.LineBreak       as B
64
65
66-- --------------------------------------------  MixText
67
68-- | Text mixable string, text, and bytestring.
69data MixText
70    = MixAppend   MixText MixText       -- ^ Append two mix texts
71    | MixBs       Bs.ByteString         -- ^ Strict bytestring
72    | MixBz       Bz.ByteString         -- ^ Lazy bytestring
73    | MixTx       Tx.Text               -- ^ Strict text
74    | MixTz       Tz.Text               -- ^ Lazy text
75    | MixString   String                -- ^ String
76    | MixSpace    Int                   -- ^ Given length spaces
77    | MixNewline  Bool                  -- ^ Hard/soft newline
78    | MixEmpty                          -- ^ Zero-length mix text
79    | MixBlock    [MixText]             -- ^ Block of mix texts
80    | MixBreak    B.LineBreak MixText   -- ^ Local line break
81
82-- | Show mix text without line break.
83instance Show MixText where
84    show mx = "MixText " ++ show (mixToStringDef mx)
85
86-- | Test equality of mix texts slowly.
87instance Eq MixText where
88    x == y = mixToBzDef x == mixToBzDef y
89
90-- | Compare mix texts slowly.
91instance Ord MixText where
92    compare x y = mixToBzDef x `compare` mixToBzDef y
93
94-- | Empty mix text.
95instance Def.Default MixText where
96    def = MixEmpty
97
98-- | Monoid like string.
99instance Monoid MixText where
100    mempty  = MixEmpty
101    mappend = MixAppend
102
103
104-- --------------------------------------------  Constructor
105
106-- ----------------------  Text
107
108-- | Create mix text from strict bytestring.
109mixBs :: Bs.ByteString -> MixText
110mixBs = MixBs
111
112-- | Create mix text from lazy bytestring.
113mixBz :: Bz.ByteString -> MixText
114mixBz = MixBz
115
116-- | Create mix text from strict text.
117mixTx :: Tx.Text -> MixText
118mixTx = MixTx
119
120-- | Create mix text from lazy text.
121mixTz :: Tz.Text -> MixText
122mixTz = MixTz
123
124-- | Create mix text from string.
125--
126--   >>> mixString "abc" <> mixString "def"
127--   MixText "abcdef"
128--
129mixString :: String -> MixText
130mixString = MixString
131
132-- | Create mix text from char.
133mixChar :: Char -> MixText
134mixChar c = mixString [c]
135
136-- | Put mix text to left edge in given-length char sequence.
137--
138--   >>> mixLeft '.' 10 $ mixString "abc"
139--   MixText "abc......."
140--
141mixLeft :: Char -> Int -> MixText -> MixText
142mixLeft c n mx = mixString $ O.padRightWith c n $ mixToStringDef mx
143
144-- | Put mix text to right edge in given-length char sequence.
145--
146--   >>> mixRight '.' 10 $ mixString "abc"
147--   MixText ".......abc"
148--
149mixRight :: Char -> Int -> MixText -> MixText
150mixRight c n mx = mixString $ O.padLeftWith c n $ mixToStringDef mx
151
152-- ----------------------  Space
153
154-- | Create mix text of given-length spaces.
155--
156--   >>> mixString "|" <> mixSpace 4 <> mixString "|"
157--   MixText "|    |"
158--
159mixSpace :: Int -> MixText
160mixSpace = MixSpace
161
162-- | Infix mix space.
163--
164--   >>> mixString "a" `mixSep` mixString "b"
165--   MixText "a b"
166--
167mixSep :: MixText -> MixText -> MixText
168mixSep l r = l <> mix1 <> r
169
170-- | Infix mix space.
171--
172--   >>> mixString "a" `mixSep2` mixString "b"
173--   MixText "a  b"
174--
175mixSep2 :: MixText -> MixText -> MixText
176mixSep2 l r = l <> mix2 <> r
177
178-- | Empty space.
179mix0 :: MixText
180mix0 = mixSpace 0
181
182-- | One space.
183mix1 :: MixText
184mix1 = mixSpace 1
185
186-- | Two-length spaces.
187mix2 :: MixText
188mix2 = mixSpace 2
189
190-- | Three-length spaces.
191mix3 :: MixText
192mix3 = mixSpace 3
193
194-- | Four-length spaces.
195mix4 :: MixText
196mix4 = mixSpace 4
197
198-- ----------------------  Number
199
200-- | Mix text of octal number.
201--
202--  >>> mixOct (12 :: Int)
203--  MixText "14"
204--
205mixOct :: (Integral n, Show n) => n -> MixText
206mixOct = mixNum N.showOct
207
208-- | Mix text of decimal number.
209--
210--  >>> mixDec (12 :: Int)
211--  MixText "12"
212--
213mixDec :: (Integral n, Show n) => n -> MixText
214mixDec = mixNum N.showInt
215
216-- | Mix text of hexadecimal number.
217--
218--  >>> mixHex (12 :: Int)
219--  MixText "c"
220--
221mixHex :: (Integral n, Show n) => n -> MixText
222mixHex = mixNum N.showHex
223
224mixNum :: (Integral n, Show n) => (n -> ShowS) -> n -> MixText
225mixNum f n | n >= 0    = mixString (f n "")
226           | otherwise = mixChar '-' <> mixString (f (abs n) "")
227
228-- | Zero-padding decimal number.
229--
230--   >>> mixDecZero 6 $ O.int 123
231--   MixText "000123"
232--
233--   >>> mixDecZero 6 $ O.int (-123)
234--   MixText "-00123"
235--
236mixDecZero :: (Integral n, Show n) => Int -> n -> MixText
237mixDecZero = mixNumZero mixDec
238
239-- | Generalized version of 'mixDecZero'.
240--
241--   >>> mixNumZero mixHex 6 $ O.int 123
242--   MixText "00007b"
243--
244mixNumZero :: (Integral n, Show n) => (n -> MixText) -> Int -> n -> MixText
245mixNumZero f w n | n >= 0     = mixRight '0' w (f n)
246                 | otherwise  = mixChar '-' <> mixRight '0' (w - 1) (f $ abs n)
247
248-- | Sign of number or space.
249--
250--   >>> mixSign $ O.int 3
251--   MixText "+"
252--
253--   >>> mixSign $ O.int (-3)
254--   MixText "-"
255--
256--   >>> mixSign $ O.int 0
257--   MixText " "
258--
259mixSign :: (Num n, Ord n) => n -> MixText
260mixSign n = case compare n 0 of
261              GT -> mixChar '+'
262              LT -> mixChar '-'
263              EQ -> mixChar ' '
264
265-- ----------------------  Newline
266
267-- | Append line break.
268mixLine :: MixText -> MixText
269mixLine = (<> mixHard)
270
271-- | Append line break to each mix texts.
272mixLines :: [MixText] -> MixText
273mixLines = mconcat . map mixLine
274
275-- | Soft line break, i.e., suppress at the beginning of line.
276mixSoft :: MixText
277mixSoft = MixNewline False
278
279-- | Hard line break, i.e., suppress only after auto line break.
280mixHard :: MixText
281mixHard = MixNewline True
282
283-- | Mix text with local line break setting.
284mixBreak :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> MixText
285mixBreak = MixBreak
286
287-- ----------------------  Block
288
289-- | Block of multiple mix texts.
290mixBlock :: [MixText] -> MixText
291mixBlock = MixBlock
292
293-- | Map function to mix texts directly in mix block.
294--
295--   >>> let m1 = mixBlock [mixString "cd", mixString "ef" <> mixBlock [mixString "g"]]
296--   >>> let m2 = mixBlock [mixString "ab", m1]
297--
298--   >>> m2
299--   MixText "abcdegh"
300--
301--   >>> mixBlockMap mixLine m2
302--   MixText "ab\r\ncd\r\nefg\r\n"
303--
304--   >>> mixBlockMap (\x -> mixString "[" <> x <> mixString "]") m2
305--   MixText "[ab][cd][efg]"
306--
307mixBlockMap :: (MixText -> MixText) -> MixText -> MixText
308mixBlockMap f = loop where
309    loop (MixBlock xs) = MixBlock (loop <$> xs)
310    loop m = f m
311
312-- ----------------------  Others
313
314-- | Showed mix text.
315--
316--   >>> mixShow (Just 'a')
317--   MixText "Just 'a'"
318--
319mixShow :: (Show a) => a -> MixText
320mixShow = mixString . show
321
322-- | Empty mix text.
323--
324--   >>> mixEmpty
325--   MixText ""
326--
327mixEmpty :: MixText
328mixEmpty = MixEmpty
329
330
331-- --------------------------------------------  Concatenate
332
333-- | Convert mix text to lazy bytestring builder.
334mixToBuilder :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> B.Builder
335mixToBuilder lb mx =
336    case mixBuild lb mx (Bw mempty 0) of
337      (b, _, _) -> b
338
339-- | Convert mix text to lazy bytestring.
340mixToBz :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> Bz.ByteString
341mixToBz lb = B.toLazyByteString . mixToBuilder lb
342
343mixToBzDef :: MixText -> Bz.ByteString
344mixToBzDef = mixToBz Def.def
345
346-- | Convert mix text to string.
347mixToString :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> String
348mixToString lb = Bu.toString . mixToBz lb
349
350-- | Convert mix text to string without line breaks.
351mixToFlatString :: MixText -> String
352mixToFlatString = mixToString B.noBreak
353
354mixToStringDef :: MixText -> String
355mixToStringDef = mixToString Def.def
356
357-- ----------------------  Put
358
359-- | Print mix text to the standard output.
360putMix :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> IO ()
361putMix lb = hPutMix lb IO.stdout
362
363-- | Print mix text and newline to the standard output.
364putMixLn :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> IO ()
365putMixLn lb = hPutMixLn lb IO.stdout
366
367-- | Print mix text to the given output handler.
368hPutMix :: B.LineBreak -> IO.Handle -> MixText -> IO ()
369hPutMix lb h = B.hPutBuilder h . mixToBuilder lb
370
371-- | Print mix text and newline to the given output handler.
372hPutMixLn :: B.LineBreak -> IO.Handle -> MixText -> IO ()
373hPutMixLn lb h mx = B.hPutBuilder h $ mixToBuilder lb $ mixLine mx
374
375-- | Print mix text lines to the standard output.
376putMixLines :: B.LineBreak -> [MixText] -> IO ()
377putMixLines lb = hPutMixLines lb IO.stdout
378
379-- | Print mix text lines to the given output handler.
380hPutMixLines :: B.LineBreak -> IO.Handle -> [MixText] -> IO ()
381hPutMixLines lb h = hPutMix lb h . mixLines
382
383-- | Write mix text to a file.
384writeMix :: B.LineBreak -> FilePath -> MixText -> IO ()
385writeMix lb path mx = E.bracket open IO.hClose body where
386    open   = IO.openBinaryFile path IO.WriteMode
387    body h = hPutMix lb h mx
388
389-- ----------------------  Build
390
391-- Builder, width of the builder, and next spaces.
392type Bld = (B.Builder, Int, Int)
393
394-- Auto break function.
395type Auto = Bld -> Int -> B.Builder -> Bld
396
397-- Hard break function.
398type Hard = Bld -> Bld
399
400-- Builder and width without next spaces.
401pattern Bw b w = (b, w, -1)
402
403-- After autobreak.
404pattern Br b w = (b, w, -2)
405
406bsSpaces :: Int -> Bs.ByteString
407bsSpaces n = Bs.replicate n 32
408
409mixBuild :: B.LineBreak -> MixText -> Bld -> Bld
410mixBuild lb mx bld = mixBuildBody (auto $ B.breakWidth lb) hard bld mx where
411    auto (Nothing) (b,_,s) _  b2  = Bw (b <> space s <> b2) 0
412    auto (Just wd) (b,w,s) w2 b2
413        | w + s + w2 > wd         = Br (b <> nl <> ind <> b2) (indw + w2)
414        | otherwise               = Bw (b <> space s   <> b2) (w + s + w2)
415
416    hard (Br b 0)                 = Bw (b) 0
417    hard (b, _, _)                = Bw (b <> nl) 0
418
419    nl           = continueBuilder lb
420    (ind, indw)  = indentBuilder   lb
421    space        = B.byteString . bsSpaces
422
423mixBuildBody :: Auto -> Hard -> Bld -> MixText -> Bld
424mixBuildBody auto hard = (<<) where
425    bld << MixAppend x y   = bld << x << y
426    bld << MixBs b         = cat bld (bsWidth b)       $ B.byteString b
427    bld << MixBz b         = cat bld (bzWidth b)       $ B.lazyByteString b
428    bld << MixTx t         = cat bld (txWidth t)       $ Tx.encodeUtf8Builder t
429    bld << MixTz t         = cat bld (tzWidth t)       $ Tz.encodeUtf8Builder t
430    bld << MixString s     = cat bld (O.stringWidth s) $ B.stringUtf8 s
431    bld << MixSpace s'     = space bld s'
432    bld << MixNewline b    = nl b bld
433    bld << MixEmpty        = bld
434    bld << MixBlock xs     = L.foldl' (<<) bld xs
435    bld << MixBreak lb x   = mixBuild lb x bld
436
437    cat bld@(b, w, s) w2 b2
438        | s < 0            = Bw (b <> b2) (w + w2)
439        | otherwise        = auto bld w2 b2
440
441    space (b, w, s) s'     = (b, w, max s s')
442
443    nl False bld@(_, 0, _) = bld
444    nl False bld           = hard bld
445    nl True  bld           = hard bld
446
447-- ----------------------  Width
448
449bsWidth :: Bs.ByteString -> Int
450bsWidth = Bs.length
451
452bzWidth :: Bz.ByteString -> Int
453bzWidth = fromInteger . toInteger . Bz.length
454
455txWidth :: Tx.Text -> Int
456txWidth = Tx.length
457
458tzWidth :: Tz.Text -> Int
459tzWidth = fromInteger . toInteger . Tz.length
460
461
462-- --------------------------------------------  LineBreak
463
464continueBuilder :: B.LineBreak -> B.Builder
465continueBuilder B.LineBreak { B.breakContinue = nl } = B.stringUtf8 nl
466
467indentBuilder :: B.LineBreak -> (B.Builder, Int)
468indentBuilder B.LineBreak { B.breakIndent = i } = (B.stringUtf8 i, O.stringWidth i)
469
